articles.title: Talks between Secretary of C.C., WPK and Chairman of International Committee of Social-Democratic Party of Germany
articles.content:
Talks between Secretary of C.C., WPK and Chairman of International Committee of Social-Democratic Party of Germany
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Talks were held on Sept. 8 between Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), who is heading the delegation of the WPK on a visit to Germany and Niels Annen, chairman of the International Committee of the Social-Democratic Party of Germany.
					 Present there on the WPK side were members of the delegation and the DPRK ambassador to Germany and on the opposite side the coordinator for Foreign Policy of the Social-Democratic Party Group from the Bundestag (Federal Parliament) and the director of the Headquarters Office of the "Friedrich Ebert" Foundation of the Social-Democratic Party.
					
					 Discussed at the talks were issues of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties.
					
					 The WPK delegation was invited to a reception given by Niels Annen on the same day.
					
					 Meanwhile, Kang Sok Ju met and had a talk with the representative of the German Foreign Ministry and other officials concerned.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Kyodo News
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Kyodo News
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Kyodo News headed by President Masaki Fukuyama at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Kim Chang Gwang, director general of the Korean Central News Agency, and officials concerned.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Uganda Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Uganda Appointed
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Myong Kyong Chol was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Uganda, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kyodo News Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Kyodo News Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Kyodo News headed by President Masaki Fukuyama visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Members of the delegation went round historic relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae, being briefed on the revolutionary and patriotic lives of Kim Il Sung and his family members. 
					
					 They also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea and the Mansudae Art Studio.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The British delegation of businessmen led by Evgeny Lebedev visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Wednesday.
					 They laid bouquets before the statues in humblest reverence and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Delegation of EU-Asia Centre Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of EU-Asia Centre Leaves
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the EU-Asia Centre led by Director Fraser Cameron left here on Wednesday.

articles.title: Mirae Scientists Street to Be Built in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Mirae Scientists Street to Be Built in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The construction of Mirae (future) Scientists Street began in Pyongyang, the capital city of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The street will be arranged by high-rise and skyscraping apartments for more than 500 households and modern public and service buildings.
					
					 Its construction was initiated by supreme leader Kim Jong Un in May this year when he toured the apartment houses for educators of Kim Chaek University of Technology under construction. He personally named the street, to take its shape along the bank of the Taedong River, "Mirae Scientists Street."
					
					 And he stressed the need to ensure the internal and external layouts for the street on the highest level, providing the competent building force made up of army units.
					
					 Now, soldier-builders are working admirable feats every day to carry out the construction of street in the set time.

articles.title: Soccer Match Played
articles.content:
Soccer Match Played
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- A soccer match between the April 25 and the Hwoebul teams took place at the Kim Il Sung Stadium Tuesday to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.  They respectively placed first and second in the finals for Hwoebul Cup on August 28.
					 Among the spectators were senior party and state officials, officials of the Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission and supporting organizations and working people and youth and students in Pyongyang.
					
					 Also among the spectators were the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK, delegations of overseas Koreans, visiting groups and other overseas compatriots staying in the socialist homeland and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 Diplomatic envoys, representatives of international bodies and military attaches of foreign embassies here and their wives and other foreign guests were also among the spectators.
					
					 The April 25 Team beat the Hwoebul Team 2:0.

articles.title: Furniture and Daily Necessities Design Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Furniture and Daily Necessities Design Exhibition Opens
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The furniture and daily necessities design exhibition opened in the DPRK with due ceremony at the State Industrial Art Exhibition Hall on Wednesday. 
					 On display there are more than 380 peculiar and useful designs and at least 430 products presented by creators, teachers, researchers and students of industrial art creating units and educational fields and designers and workers of units manufacturing furniture and daily necessities. 
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Kim Yong Jin, officials concerned, creators, designers, teachers, students and art fans. 
					
					 Kim Yong Jin in an opening address called for producing more designs and products meeting Koreans' taste and sense of beauty. 
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants went round the exhibition hall.

articles.title: Great Persons' Feats for Education in Korea
articles.content:
Great Persons' Feats for Education in Korea
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The 13th National Meeting of Educators, recently held here, marked a historic landmark in glorifying President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il's idea on Juche-based education and their leadership feats and bringing about a drastic turn in education in the new century.
					 President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime had paid deep attention to the educational work with his noble outlook on the posterity and future.
					
					 In the period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, he saw to it that such schools as Samsong School in Wujiazi, Jinmyong School in Kalun and Samgwang School in Guyushu were set up to ensure free education for children.
					
					 After Korea's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, he took a measure to establish a popular education system in the country even under the complicated situation. It resulted in emergence of Kim Il Sung University, Samhung Secondary School and many other educational institutions.
					
					 During the 1950-1953 Fatherland Liberation War, the President took such steps as recalling servicepersons from the front to their campus and carrying textbooks and educational equipment and apparatuses by military vehicles.
					
					 In the postwar rehabilitation period he saw to it that much portion of the government funds was allotted to reconstructing schools before anything else, and frequently visited schools under construction, settling the knotty problems.
					
					 Under his wise guidance, the DPRK introduced the universal compulsory primary and secondary education systems and enforced the universal compulsory nine-year technical education from Juche 56 (1967) and then the universal compulsory 11-year education system.
					
					 He also authored "Theses on Socialist Education" to give comprehensive and perfect exposition of all the matters arising in educational work.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il made public "On Further Developing Educational Work" and other celebrated works to kindle the flames of innovation in the education throughout the country and thoroughly implement the theses on socialist education.
					
					 He made sure that the state expenditure for educational services was increased annually even in the period of the Arduous March, and visited universities and other schools to bring about a turn in the educational work as required by the new century.
					
					 Today the Juche-based education in the DPRK has entered a new turning point under the guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un took a measure for enforcing the universal 12-year compulsory education in keeping with the developing realities and gave important teachings for the education of rising generations, touring Mangyongdae Revolutionary School, Changjon Primary School and other educational units.
					
					 He has shown his deep trust and loving care for the educators, seeing to it that modern apartment houses for them are built at scenic sites of the capital city and visiting their families who moved to new flats.
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's idea on the Juche-based education and their exploits will go down forever under the energetic guidance of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on U.S. Ulterior Aims in Developing WMDs
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on U.S. Ulterior Aims in Developing WMDs
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- There occurred a serious accident at the Kodiak launching complex in Alaska, U.S. on August 25.
					 It was a failure in the test-fire of an ultrasound missile which the U.S. claimed it developed to mount a precision strike at any place of the world within one hour.
					
					 Four seconds after its launch the missile exploded, engulfing all installations in the complex in flames.
					
					 It was a natural outcome as the U.S. has gone mad with arms buildup defying the worldwide protest and denunciation.
					
					 A saying goes every sin brings its punishment with it.
					
					 Behind the curtain of "disarmament", the U.S. has stepped up the development of all types of WMDs.
					
					 It is working hard to make the public convince that its disarmament is aimed at peace in a bid to let other big powers slacken their vigilance and, at the same time, step up the development of new type sophisticated weapons with huge financial investment. 
					
					 Among them are ultrasound missile that caused the recent disaster, flying submarine and 2g micro projectile.
					
					 The U.S. is massively building new type warships while accelerating the modernization of nuclear weapons.
					
					 This year it conducted the test of verifying the launching capacity of portable anti-tank missile Javelin, the test-fire of laser-guided rocket Talon, the test of Aegis combat system of destroyer and missile interception test, thus further increasing than ever before the capability to fight a war.
					
					 Lurking behind such arms buildup of the U.S. is its sinister ambition to dominate the world by holding a military edge.
					
					 It is the U.S. invariable hegemonic scenario to militarily prevail over other big powers in Asia-Pacific.
					
					 It is clearly proved by the remarks of officials concerned of the U.S. Defense Department that the development of the ultrasound missile is to cope with China's rapid development of ultrasound weapons.
					
					 Lots of countries, big powers in particular, are channeling big efforts into increasing military capacity to cope with the U.S. moves for boosting the capability for fighting a war.
					
					 Earlier this year, China conducted the test-fire of ultrasound missile whose maximum speed is 10 times that of sound. Russia is also buckling down to developing such weapon and India is reportedly joining it.
					
					 The situation proves once again that the U.S. moves for developing WMDs for containing major big powers are sparking off a fresh arms race in the world.
					
					 The U.S. is an arch criminal escalating arms race and the tension in the world and a chief culprit harassing world peace and stability.
					
					 In case the world arms race escalates, the U.S. will be hit hardest as it has poor financial conditions.
					
					 The U.S. had better behave with discretion, well aware of where it stands.

articles.title: U.S. Troops Urged to Withdraw from S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Troops Urged to Withdraw from S. Korea
September 10 (KCNA) -- The Institute for Strategic Studies affiliated to U.S. Army College of War recently made public a report which said the U.S. forces present in south Korea are not effective in the light of "important change of strategic environment" and "increasing expenses" and they might be "inactive victims". A senior fellow at the Cato Research Institute of the U.S. contributed an article to the magazine Forbes asserting that U.S. forces'  presence in south Korea is not necessary any longer. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a commentary:
					
					 This proves that the U.S. forces' presence in south Korea is quite contrary to the times and a major factor of disturbing peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia. 
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists suffered a bitter defeat in the Korean War in the 1950s after igniting it. However, they have bolstered up their troops in south Korea both in quantity and quality, watching for a chance for a new war for aggression, far from drawing a lesson from their defeat. 
					
					 South Korea has turned into a base for a war for invading the DPRK and the rest of Asia and the biggest advanced nuclear base in the Far East. 
					
					 The U.S. is going to ignite the second Korean War at any cost, sparking an arms race and increasing the war danger not only in the Korean peninsula but also in the rest of Northeast Asia. 
					
					 The U.S. forces' presence in south Korea is a leftover of the Cold War. 
					
					 There is no justification for the U.S. to keep its forces in south Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. call for permanent presence of its troops in south Korea is an anachronistic and foolish gangster-like logic and a warlike action based on the Cold War-minded way of thinking. 
					
					 The U.S. troops in south Korea should be withdrawn as early as possible. If not, they would be wiped out to the last man in case of emergency.

articles.title: Police Suppression of Media Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Police Suppression of Media Denounced in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Scholar Ko Sung U posted an article on the south Korean internet paper Saram Ilbo on Sept. 4 in denunciation of the puppet police's illegal violation of the freedom of speech.
					 The article said that recently the police across south Korea forced the media organs which reported north-related articles to delete them. 
					
					 For example, the police authorities in Kyonggi and North Jolla provinces sent official papers to media organs in Seoul and Kyonggi Province demanding them delete the north-related articles, the article noted, and went on:
					
					 Most of those articles dealt with news items of Yonhap News or quoted what it said. 
					
					 It is hardly understandable for the police to make unilateral interpretation of news items of Yonhap News as "pro-north ones" and take administrative actions as it officially performs the function of receiving and reporting news about the north. 
					
					 It is the abuse of power unprecedented in the past military dictatorial regime that the police demanded media delete articles. 
					
					 Recalling that the police are working hard to create a terror-ridden situation under the pretext of security, the article termed this a very serious development.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Lauded by Political Figure of DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Lauded by Political Figure of DR Congo
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Otete Gaston Mboyo, deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the DR Congo and chairman of the DR Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, issued a statement on September 2 on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The statement said that on the significant occasion progressive humankind extends the highest tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who turned the DPRK into an ideal society.
					
					 After embarking on the road of the revolution in his early years, the President founded the immortal Juche idea and fought bloody battles against the Japanese imperialists for 20 years, thus liberating Korea, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 With his lofty intention to build a people's country in Korea, the President advanced the unique line on building people's power during the anti-Japanese struggle and accumulated a wealth of experience for embodying it and finally founded the DPRK on September 9, 1948 after the liberation of the country.
					
					 The founding of the DPRK clearly proved in practice in the eyes of the world people what kind of society the one in which the popular masses are masters of everything and everything serves them is.
					
					 Kim Jong Il who had successfully carried forward the revolutionary cause of Kim Il Sung proclaimed the programme for modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism, achieved the single-minded unity of the people around the leader, pursued unique Songun politics and firmly defended socialist Korea from the hostile forces' ever-more undisguised moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The great feats performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for socialist construction and the global cause of independence will shine for all ages.

articles.title: Foreign Media Observe Birthday of DPRK
articles.content:
Foreign Media Observe Birthday of DPRK
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups or aired special programs on the occasion of the 66th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 The Nepalese paper Arpan on Aug. 29 featured an article titled "Might of DPRK" illustrated with a photo of smiling President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The article said that on the strength of firm unity the Korean people gained victories in the anti-Japanese armed struggle and the Fatherland Liberation War and built a socialist society centered on the popular masses. 
					
					 The great unity of the service personnel and people, the basis and dynamics of the Korean revolution, has served as a source of conviction in the bright prospect for building a thriving nation, the article noted.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper News Today on Aug. 27 said in an article titled "Towards high peak of a thriving nation" that the DPRK, dynamically advancing towards the high peak of a thriving nation, would win a shining victory in the drive for the building of a thriving nation before long.
					
					 The Algerian paper Saut Al Ahrar on Aug. 16 carried an article titled "DPRK celebrating the 66th founding anniversary speeds up the advance for construction".
					
					 The article said Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK on Sept. 9, 1948 and wisely led the successful enforcement of various democratic reforms.
					
					 F. M. 90.5 Radio of Cambodia on Aug. 28 aired a program saying that Kim Il Sung, founder of the DPRK, built it into a prosperous socialist country.
					
					 Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il, successor to the cause of Kim Il Sung, developed the DPRK into an impregnable socialist power, the radio said.
					
					 The Cambodian state broadcasting service aired the same program on the same day.

articles.title: Seminars Held Abroad
articles.content:
Seminars Held Abroad
Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Seminars on exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il took place in various countries on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 They were held by the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Kolfe Branch and other branches of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea, the Adita Ariya Prawira Ship Co. and the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. of Indonesia from August 28 to September 3.
					
					 The chairman of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and other speakers spoke highly of the feats performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il by founding and developing the DPRK and glorifying it as a socialist fortress.
					
					 The chief of the Kolfe Branch of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea said Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK, the first people's democratic state in the East, on September 9, 1948 after the liberation of Korea on the basis of the historical experience gained in establishing the people's revolutionary government in the guerrilla bases during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 The manager of the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. of Indonesia said that the history of the DPRK is a glorious history in which Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il developed the DPRK into a socialist fortress and a fortress of independence against imperialism based on the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 The victory won by the DPRK in the Korean war in the 1950s and other victories won by it in the battle for defending socialism in the 1990s and in the 21st century are a shining fruition of the unique idea, politics and leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he stressed.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de agencia japonesa Kyodo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de agencia japonesa Kyodo
Pyongyang, 10 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 10 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de la agencia noticiera japonesa Kyodo encabezada por el presidente Masaki Fukuyama. 
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion el director general de la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea, Kim Chang Gwang, y otros funcionarios coreanos.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador de RPDC en Uganda
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador de RPDC en Uganda
Pyongyang, 10 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Segun un decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Myong Kyong Chol fue designado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC a acreditarse en la Republica de Uganda.

articles.title: Iniciada la construccion de avenida de cientificos Mirae
articles.content:
Iniciada la construccion de avenida de cientificos Mirae
Pyongyang, 10 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Comenzo en esta capital la construccion de la avenida de cientificos Mirae. 
					En la nueva avenida se levantaran magnificamente los apartamentos rascacielos con mas de 500 viviendas, las casas cunas, los jardines de infancia, la red de servicios publicos y otros edificios modernos. 
					
					En mayo pasado, el Mariscal Kim Jong Un visito el campo de construccion de viviendas para los educadores de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek.
					
					En esa ocasion, el instruyo formar una avenida entera a las riberas del rio Taedong al construir 500 viviendas mas para los educadores del plantel docente referido y los establecimientos de servicios publicos en torno a las viviendas en construccion y denomino su nombre como "avenida de cientificos Mirae". 
					
					Envio a los constructores militares competentes llamando a producir otra vez una revolucion en la construccion al acondicionar en el maximo nivel el interior y el exterior de la nueva avenida. 
					
					Estimulados por las actividades de propaganda y agitacion artisticas, los constructores militares crean ahora los meritos heroicos en la obra.

articles.title: ACNC comenta fracaso de lanzamiento de misil ultrasonico de EE.UU.
articles.content:
ACNC comenta fracaso de lanzamiento de misil ultrasonico de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 10 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El pasado 25 de agosto, ocurrio gran accidente en un campo de lanzamiento, situado en el Estado de Alaska de Estados Unidos.
					Resulto un fracaso la prueba de tiro de misil ultrasonico que se ha desarrollado para atacar a precision cualquier parte del mundo dentro de una hora.
					
					El artefacto exploto a los 4 segundos de lanzamiento y sus restos envueltos en llamas destruyeron todas las instalaciones en el campo de lanzamiento.
					
					Es un castigo merecido a EE.UU. que se afana en el aumento armamentista pese a la fuerte protesta del mundo.
					
					Ahora, detras de la cortina de "desarme", el imperio da acicate al desarrollo de diversas armas de exterminio masivo.
					
					Con el vistoso cartel de "desarme", EE.UU. engana la opinion publica y relaja a las potencias por una parte y por la otra, asigna enormes fondos en el desarrollo de nuevas armas sofisticadas, entre otras, el misil fracasado esta vez, el "submarino volador", el objeto volador que pesa 2g, etc.
					
					Tambien, construye muchos y nuevos buques de guerra.
					
					En este ano, realizo sucesivamente las pruebas de capacidad de tiro del misil portatil antitanque Javelin, el tiro de cohete teledirigido por laser Talon, el sistema de combate Aegis del destructor y la interceptacion de misil.
					
					Todas esas acciones militares obedecen al siniestro intento de EE.UU. de tomar a toda costa la hegemonia mundial mediante la superioridad militar.
					
					Para ese fin, trata de atropellar militarmente a las potencias regionales de Asia-Pacifico.
					
					En ese contexto, los funcionarios del Departamento de Defensa estadounidense dicen que el desarrollo de misil ultrasonico es para hacer frente al desarrollo rapido de armas supersonicas de China.
					
					Muchos paises del mundo, sobre todo, las potencias, prestan mucha atencion al aumento de sus fuerzas armadas como contramedida a las aventuras militares de EE.UU.
					
					A principios del ano en curso, China realizo el ensayo de lanzamiento de misil ultrasonico cuya velocidad maxima es 10 veces mayor que la velocidad del sonido. Rusia y la India tambien se esfuerzan por desarrollar las armas del mismo tipo.
					
					La realidad compraba una vez mas que el desarrollo de armas de exterminio masivo por parte de EE.UU. causa la nueva carrera armamentista en el mundo.
					
					En fin de cuentas, EE.UU. es el culpable principal que exacerba la carrera armamentista y la tension internacional y perturba la paz y la estabilidad del mundo.
					
					Si se agrava en el mundo la carrera armamentista, EE.UU. sera perjudicado mas que nadie debido a su deplorable situacion financiera.
					
					EE.UU. debe actuar con prudencia.
